topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571fef563687279f6051900#post_5571fef563687279f6051900
[bq="Thanotos Omega"]"@Princess♠Molestia":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5571fca663687279f62f1400#post_5571fca663687279f62f1400
The idea of my rules is for people like me who grow up in a bubble to help notice when they are omitting people out of habit, lots of writers would be fine with having a black man as the lawyer confidant of a super hero but may never even think of it because on a sub conscious level we all tend towards certain perceived norms, that's what the 3 questions are meant to address,[/bq]
There are many other different avenues for people to promote diversity instead of shoehorning things into already established media. If they really want to express their ideology, why do they practice and try to create their own pieces? Let the devs themselves decide what they want to create and let the customers vote with their wallets.

Also

Fantasy =\= reality

topics.body:
"@Thanotos Omega":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/5572139d6368720dc48b0e00#post_5572139d6368720dc48b0e00
Still. I'm all for diversity. But not if such would interfere with the lore in fictions. Stop injecting real life crap into things that don't call for them. If the creators themselves want to put those stuff in their work, it's all cool. But it should not be up to the laymen to decide directly. People vote with their wallets.

Also if you can't keep fantasy from reality seperate. You have an issue.
